text: hi everyone anthony fantano here the
internet's busiest
music nerd and it's time for a review
of the new sufian stevens record the
ascension
this is a new lp of songs from singer
composer
multi-instrumentalist producer
songwriter sufian stevens
expanding his versatile discography once
again with this 80-minute
epic the ascension it has been five
years since the release of his
last major studio project carrion lowell
can't say it feels like it though as he
has filled that time with plenty of
collaborations and
side projects though his core records
tend to vary so much in sound
it's hard to see anything he's doing
ever as a digression
however it does seem like he wants this
record to be at least a bit of a focal
point
in his catalog considering how much he's
putting into it considering how
massive it is plus he's essentially
returning to the textured
glitchy electronics that fans loved so
much on the age of odds
now it's no secret that record is not
one of my
favorite sufian projects however his
sound is always changing
it's always evolving i would never
expect him to do the same thing twice
even if it's another electronic album
another folk album
another collab with his stepdad now the
ascension
even though once again it has a pretty
long run time i found
this record to be pretty easy to digest
you just have to have the time to commit
to it and i mean commit to it because
this is a
subtle nuanced lp that rewards attention
to its many details
going into this record i do admit i did
fear at least a little bit another age
of odds type experience
but on my first listen i was pleased and
surprised to hear
that this project wasn't really grading
to me in the same way
that album was the rhythms here didn't
come off so clunky the mixes didn't feel
quite as cluttered
generally speaking the tracks on this
one come off more serene
and i think there is a greater
appreciation of space the
track list features grandiose abstract
tension builders like america
as well as sweet direct and catchy nods
to synth pops such as video game both of
which made for
excellent teasers to the record there
are also some other tracks where i am
totally enamored with these excellent
crossovers that stevens makes into
techno and even idm in some respects i
think stevens has upped the ante here
that is shown in the numerous highlights
across the record the
opening tracks gently swelling
sputtering and twittering
synths and beats are absolutely
mesmerizing there's something about
steven's vocals here that come off
more haunting than usual too could be
the references to ghosts and forgiveness
losing touch with your desires as well
as being cornered
into a decision i feel like a spirit is
gently singing to me as i'm stuck in a
state of sleep paralysis the following
run away with me has slower pacing
and gentler tones and textures maybe it
will sound
too easy on the ears if you're going
into this thing skeptical
but once you give in to its sparkling
arpeggios ambient tones and
weeping guitar lines it creates the
sensation of
floating in slow motion over these
gentle quiet ocean waves
then die happy is maybe the most
chilling moment on the entire record its
icy
warped ringing cord sound like the
soundtrack to an out of body experience
meanwhile sufian has enough effects on
his voice to sound like a poltergeist
singing to me about wanting to die happy
the song and its sounds are genuinely
freaky
especially as he builds this wall of
throbbing bass
strange sound effects and ghoulish but
sad vocal harmonies
the bustling beat drop in the second
half of the song is easily one of the
most cathartic moments
on the entire record this track also
flows nicely into the following attivan
which delivers more surreal and
stressful imagery in its lyrics
i woke up in stereo spent the day in
vertigo i could not get the spirit
off my back later stevens expresses
these feelings
of being lost and wondering if
everything he's going through in this
moment is a part of some greater plan
then the instrumental lord it is so
tense
marked with all of these chattering
electronics and dour harmonies
the last leg is a real tension release
too with all of these industrially
tinged
hard-hitting techno beats he really
packs the noise into this track too
creating this exciting but disorienting
experience the wild and curious
landslide is another favorite of mine
here
where stevens busts out these almost
zany vocal leads that kind of roll over
each other
a lot of swelling instrumentation
underneath them too
honestly these waves if you could call
them that
sound like something from an animal
collective record but i wouldn't say
it's derivative there's definitely a
unique twist on it
outside of that the rest of the song is
loaded with these calming lead vocals
inspired poetry and methodically
assembled electronic instrumentation you
would need richard d
james himself to compute there's also
the gorgeous title track as well as
america which both leave the album's
ending feeling strong
even if in the context of the lp the
latter feels almost like a tacked-on
epilogue for the record where stevens
pretty much goes at the
currently agonizing state of our country
our society
either way it still fits in with the
haunting and meditative vibes that most
of the tracks here exhibit
except expanded in quite an ambitious
way now even with all of those
compliments i just gave this record
considered
i do also have to acknowledge there are
songs on this thing
i don't care for or even border on being
unlistenable
there's tell me you love me which i
think has a decent enough start though i
wouldn't point it out as being
one of the better songs here a good
portion of the track is solid but once
you get to this crescendo point toward
the end
that's where everything really comes
crashing down this track is far from
steven's first
grand display of instrumentation why
does this one
sound so horrendous none of the timbres
feel complementary and none of it
sounds mixed well at all listening to it
very intently i can kind of
pick out what is going into it but for
the most part
it sounds like a bunch of distorted
tubas screaming over each other with
fire engine sirens going off in harmony
i
really don't get anything out of it at
all then there is gilgamesh which for me
is an even harder swallow on the track
list
the song on this one may be cool the
lyrics might be interesting as well
and even some aspects of the
instrumental too but
those ear piercing sounds that are
popping up every once in a while
in the beat no it sounds like
nails on a chalkboard glass scraping
against
glass maybe even the breaks of a train
being pitched up or something and it is
mixed and eq'd in a way that is
just absolutely ah it's like pins in my
eardrums
i am not trying to go deaf over this
sufjan stevens record
i am not then with death star i do love
the throwback rhythms on this one it
almost feels like a rhythm nation type b
but the orchestral arrangements that
sufion works in
don't really come off as complementary
at all plus there are more
ear piercing tones on this track packed
in the background too
and again i'm not trying to go deaf or
be in pain goodbye to all that
carries the groovy momentum from death
star over
into its beats into its electronics in a
way that almost feels like a remix or
a dance mix an extension of some sort
which i think is a cool concept for
the record for the track list but with
that
the song also carries over some of the
most horrendous
ideas including those tones once
again i just see the addition of this
track as
unnecessary for the record then we also
have
sugar which is it safe to say this is
the worst writing on the entire lp
in terms of lyrics i get stevens is
attempting to dig
meaning out of these awkward cliches the
worst of which is the refrain of the
song but
it doesn't make the process of listening
to this track any more enjoyable
overall the ascension does feature some
gorgeous moments fantastic highlights
impressive experimental instrumentals
and beautiful songwriting
uh but there are some rough patches on
this thing too
which feel especially disheartening
considering how long
and demanding the record is it's hard to
enjoy the ascension
as a holistic piece of vision
and idea when all of its separate bits
aren't working
in tandem as well as they could be
feeling a decent two strong six
on this one tran position have you given
this album a listen did you love it did
you hate it what would you rate it
you're the best you're the best what
should i review next
hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell as well over here next to my head
is another video that
you can check out hit that up or the
link to subscribe to the channel
anthony fantano sufjan stevens forever
